original: Lorentzon, Anders Waldemar, konstnär, Söndrum, Halmstad, f. 10/ 6/99 i Holm, Hall. 1., av Carl L. o. Julia Ek. G. 32 m. Ingrid Sterner. Barn: Yvonne f. 33. — Stud. v. Wil- helmsons målarsk. 19-20, v. Althins målarsk. 20-21. Studrres. t. Tyskl. 22, Paris 24 o. 26, elev där av Fernand Legér. Utf. dekor :arb. i kyrkor, skolor o. privathus. Utst. i Paris, Sthlm, Gbg, Malmö, Helsingfors o. Köpenhamn. Medl. av Halmstadsgruppen o. företräd, av den surrealist, sk. Repr. å Natrmus., i in- o. uti. privatsaml.
translated: Lorentzon, Anders Waldemar, artist, Söndrum, Halmstad, born on June 10, 1899 in Holm, Halland. 1st child of Carl L. and Julia Ek. Married in 1932 to Ingrid Sterner. They have one child, Yvonne, born in 1933. Studied at Wilhelmsons Art School from 1919 to 1920, and at Althins Art School from 1920 to 1921. Further studies in Germany in 1922, and in Paris in 1924 and 1926, as a student of Fernand Léger. Executed decorative work in churches, schools, and private residences. Exhibited in Paris, Stockholm, Gothenburg, Malmö, Helsinki, and Copenhagen. Member of the Halmstad Group and representative of the surrealist movement. Works represented at the Nationalmuseum, and in various private collections.

hasCredential.name: Exhibited in Paris, Stockholm, Gothenburg, Malmö, Helsinki, and Copenhagen
Works represented at the Nationalmuseum and private collections
